Broadcast
Equipment
Today
• Canada’s new magazine for broadcast engineers, technicians and
management—published six times a year.
• Covering developments in communications technology—news of the
Canadian broadcasting industry—regulations.
• Reaching key personnel in radio and television stations, cable TV, record¬
ing studios, consulting firms, government agencies and A/V departments
of colleges and the larger boards of education from coast-to-coast.
